accounts.name: registrar
docs: The voting registrar. There can only be a single registrar
per governance realm and governing mint.

accounts.name: realm
docs: An spl-governance realm
realm is validated in the instruction:
- realm is owned by the governance_program_id
- realm_governing_token_mint must be the community or council mint
- realm_authority is realm.authority

accounts.name: governanceProgramId
docs: The program id of the spl-governance program the realm belongs to.

accounts.name: realmGoverningTokenMint
docs: Either the realm community mint or the council mint.

accounts.name: mint
docs: Tokens of this mint will produce vote weight

accounts.name: voterAuthority
docs: Authority of the voter
It can be either governing_token_owner or its delegate and must sign this instruction

accounts.name: voterAuthority
docs: Authority of the voter who casts the vote
It can be either governing_token_owner or its delegate and must sign this instruction

accounts.name: payer
docs: The account which pays for the transaction

accounts.name: governance
docs: Governance account the Proposal is for

accounts.name: voterTokenOwnerRecord
docs: TokenOwnerRecord of the voter who cast the original vote

accounts.name: voterAuthority
docs: Authority of the voter who cast the original vote
It can be either governing_token_owner or its delegate and must sign this instruction

accounts.name: voteRecord
docs: The account is used to validate that it doesn't exist and if it doesn't then Anchor owner check throws error
The check is disabled here and performed inside the instruction
#[account(owner = registrar.governance_program_id)]

accounts.name: MaxVoterWeightRecord
docs: MaxVoterWeightRecord account as defined in spl-governance-addin-api
It's redefined here without account_discriminator for Anchor to treat it as native account
The account is used as an api interface to provide max voting power to the governance program from external addin contracts

fields.name: realm
docs: The Realm the MaxVoterWeightRecord belongs to

fields.name: governingTokenMint
docs: Governing Token Mint the MaxVoterWeightRecord is associated with
Note: The addin can take deposits of any tokens and is not restricted to the community or council tokens only

fields.name: maxVoterWeight
docs: Max voter weight
The max voter weight provided by the addin for the given realm and governing_token_mint

fields.name: maxVoterWeightExpiry
docs: The slot when the max voting weight expires
It should be set to None if the weight never expires
If the max vote weight decays with time, for example for time locked based weights, then the expiry must be set
As a pattern Revise instruction to update the max weight should be invoked before governance instruction within the same transaction
and the expiry set to the current slot to provide up to date weight

fields.name: reserved
docs: Reserved space for future versions

accounts.name: NftVoteRecord
docs: Vote record indicating the given NFT voted on the Proposal
The PDA of the record is ["nft-vote-record",proposal,nft_mint]
It guarantees uniques and ensures the same NFT can't vote twice

fields.name: proposal
docs: Proposal which was voted on

fields.name: nftMint
docs: The mint of the NFT which was used for the vote

fields.name: governingTokenOwner
docs: The voter who casted this vote
It's a Realm member pubkey corresponding to TokenOwnerRecord.governing_token_owner

fields.name: amountDepositedNative
docs: Amount in deposited, in native currency. Withdraws of vested tokens
directly reduce this amount.
This directly tracks the total amount added by the user. They may
never withdraw more than this amount.

accounts.name: Registrar
docs: Instance of a voting rights distributor.

fields.name: timeOffset
docs: Debug only: time offset, to allow tests to move forward in time.

fields.name: positionUpdateAuthority
docs: Allows a program to wrap updates to the position (transfer or reset lockup)

fields.name: collection
docs: Storage for voting mints and their configuration.

accounts.name: VoterWeightRecord
docs: VoterWeightRecord account as defined in spl-governance-addin-api
It's redefined here without account_discriminator for Anchor to treat it as native account
The account is used as an api interface to provide voting power to the governance program from external addin contracts

fields.name: realm
docs: The Realm the VoterWeightRecord belongs to

fields.name: governingTokenMint
docs: Governing Token Mint the VoterWeightRecord is associated with
Note: The addin can take deposits of any tokens and is not restricted to the community or council tokens only

fields.name: governingTokenOwner
docs: The owner of the governing token and voter
This is the actual owner (voter) and corresponds to TokenOwnerRecord.governing_token_owner

fields.name: voterWeight
docs: Voter's weight
The weight of the voter provided by the addin for the given realm, governing_token_mint and governing_token_owner (voter)

fields.name: voterWeightExpiry
docs: The slot when the voting weight expires
It should be set to None if the weight never expires
If the voter weight decays with time, for example for time locked based weights, then the expiry must be set
As a common pattern Revise instruction to update the weight should be invoked before governance instruction within the same transaction
and the expiry set to the current slot to provide up to date weight

fields.name: weightAction
docs: The governance action the voter's weight pertains to
It allows to provided voter's weight specific to the particular action the weight is evaluated for
When the action is provided then the governance program asserts the executing action is the same as specified by the addin

fields.name: weightActionTarget
docs: The target the voter's weight  action pertains to
It allows to provided voter's weight specific to the target the weight is evaluated for
For example when addin supplies weight to vote on a particular proposal then it must specify the proposal as the action target
When the target is provided then the governance program asserts the target is the same as specified by the addin

fields.name: reserved
docs: Reserved space for future versions

fields.name: startTs
docs: Start of the lockup.
Note, that if start_ts is in the future, the funds are nevertheless
locked up!
Similarly vote power computations don't care about start_ts and always
assume the full interval from now to end_ts.

fields.name: endTs
docs: End of the lockup.

fields.name: kind
docs: Type of lockup.

types.name: VotingMintConfigV0
docs: Exchange rate for an asset that can be used to mint voting rights.
See documentation of configure_voting_mint for details on how
native token amounts convert to vote weight.

fields.name: mint
docs: Mint for this entry.

fields.name: baselineVoteWeightScaledFactor
docs: Vote weight factor for all funds in the account, no matter if locked or not.
In 1/SCALED_FACTOR_BASE units.

fields.name: maxExtraLockupVoteWeightScaledFactor
docs: Maximum extra vote weight factor for lockups.
This is the extra votes gained for lockups lasting lockup_saturation_secs or
longer. Shorter lockups receive only a fraction of the maximum extra vote weight,
based on lockup_time divided by lockup_saturation_secs.
In 1/SCALED_FACTOR_BASE units.

fields.name: genesisVotePowerMultiplier
docs: Genesis vote power multipliers for lockups.
This is a multiplier applied to voting power for lockups created before
genesis_extra_lockup_expiration

fields.name: genesisVotePowerMultiplierExpirationTs
docs: Timestamp of when to stop applying the genesis_extra_lockup_vote_weight_scaled_factor

fields.name: lockupSaturationSecs
docs: Number of seconds of lockup needed to reach the maximum lockup bonus.

fields.name: digitShift
docs: Number of digits to shift native amounts, applying a 10^digit_shift factor.

types.name: VoterWeightAction
docs: VoterWeightAction enum as defined in spl-governance-addin-api
It's redefined here for Anchor to export it to IDL

errors.name: InvalidRate
errors.msg: Exchange rate must be greater than zero

errors.name: InvalidDecimals
errors.msg: Exchange rate decimals cannot be larger than registrar decimals

errors.name: CastVoteIsNotAllowed
errors.msg: Cast vote is not allowed on update_voter_weight_record_v0 endpoint

errors.name: InvalidProgramId
errors.msg: Program id was not what was expected

errors.name: NoDepositOnGenesisPositions
errors.msg: You may not deposit additional tokens on a position created during the genesis period that still has the genesis multiplier

errors.name: ActiveVotesExist
errors.msg: Cannot change a position while active votes exist

errors.name: UnauthorizedPositionUpdateAuthority
errors.msg: Position update authority must sign off on this transaction

errors.name: SamePosition
errors.msg: Cannot transfer to the same position
